developedbytext.title: Developed by Boris Birmaher, M.D., Suneeta Khetarpal, M.D., Marlane Cully, M.Ed., David Brent, M.D., and Sandra McKenzie, Ph.D., Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic, University of Pittsburgh (October, 1995). E-mail: birmaherb@upmc.edu

reference.title: See: Birmaher, B., Brent, D. A., Chiappetta, L., Bridge, J., Monga, S., & Baugher, M. (1999). Psychometric properties of the Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED): a replication study. Journal of the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry, 38(10), 1230–6.

tabular.title: Screen for Child Anxiety Related Disorders (SCARED)

directionsdata.title: Below is a list of sentences that describe how people feel. Read each phrase and decide if it is “Not True or Hardly Ever True” or “Somewhat True or Sometimes True” or “Very True or Often True” for you. Then,  for each sentence, fill in one circle that corresponds to the response that seems to describe you for the last 3 months.

notTrue.title: Not True or Hardly Ever True

frightened.title: 1. When I feel frightened, it is hard to breathe

headaches.title: 2. I get headaches when I am at school

people.title: 3. I don’t like to be with people I don’t know well

scared.title: 4. I get scared if I sleep away from home

liking.title: 5. I worry about other people liking me

frightened.title: 6. When I get frightened, I feel like passing out

mother.title: 8. I follow my mother or father wherever they go

looknervous.title: 9. People tell me that I look nervous

nervous.title: 10. I feel nervous with people I don’t know well

frightened.title: 12. When I get frightened, I feel like I am going crazy

worry.title: 14. I worry about being as good as other kids

frightened.title: 15. When I get frightened, I feel like things are not real

nightmares.title: 16. I have nightmares about something bad happening to my parents

school.title: 17. I worry about going to school

frightened.title: 18. When I get frightened, my heart beats fast

nightmares.title: 20. I have nightmares about something bad happening to me

working.title: 21. I worry about things working out for me

frightened.title: 22. When I get frightened, I sweat a lot
24. I get really frightened for no reason at al

alone.title: 25. I am afraid to be alone in the house

people.title: 26. It is hard for me to talk with people I don’t know well

frightened.title: 27. When I get frightened, I feel like I am choking

worry.title: 28. People tell me that I worry too much

away.title: 29. I don’t like to be away from my family

anxiety.title: 30. I  am afraid of having anxiety (or panic) attacks

parents.title: 31. I  worry   that something bad might happen to my parents

people.title: 32. I feel shy with people I don’t know well

worry.title: 33. I  worry about what is going to happen in the future

frightened.title: 34. When I get frightened, I feel like throwing up

worry.title: 35. I  worry about how well I do things

scared.title: 36. I am scared to go to school

worry.title: 37. I worry about things that have already happened

frightened.title: 38. When I get frightened, I feel dizzy

nervous.title: 39. I feel nervous when I am with other children or adults and I have to do something while they watch me (for example: read aloud, speak, play a       game, play a sport)

parties.title: 40. I feel nervous when I am going to parties, dances, or any place where there will be people that I don’t know well

scoreAboveTwentyFive.title: A total score of ≥ 25 may indicate the presence of an Anxiety Disorder. Scores higher than 30 are more specific.

scoreOfSeven.title: A score of 7 for items 1, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 19, 22, 24, 27, 30, 34, 38 may indicate Panic Disorder or Significant Somatic Symptoms.

scoreOfNine.title: A score of 9 for items 5, 7, 14, 21, 23, 28, 33, 35, 37 may indicate Generalized Anxiety Disorder.

scoreOfFive.title: A score of 5 for items 4, 8, 13, 16, 20, 25, 29, 31 may indicate Separation Anxiety SOC.

scoreOfEight.title: A score of 8 for items 3, 10, 26, 32, 39, 40, 41 may indicate Social Anxiety Disorder.

scoreOfThree.title: A score of 3 for items 2, 11, 17, 36 may indicate Significant School Avoidance.

childrenEightEleven.title: For children ages 8 to 11, it is recommended that the clinician explain all questions, or have the child answer the questionnaire sitting with an adult in case they have any questions.

referalsite.title: The SCARED is available at no cost at www.wpic.pitt.edu/research under tools and assessments, or at www.pediatric bipolar.pitt.edu under instruments
